comments.commentBody: What makes you think that no one else is doing anything?  Nothing could be farther from the truth.  But that doesn't excuse inaction on the part of the country with the biggest scientific and research community in the world.

Talk about melodrama. Try watching George Carlin's monologue on the climate. It's on Youtube. Both funny and to the point. I'll summarize for you:

Even if mankind lasts another 10 million years (an unlikely event; we'll be extinct long before that), the earth will still have several billion years left before the sun dies. If aliens should visit earth in....say....20 million years, what will they find? They'll find a beautiful blue-green ball utterly teeming with life. There will be no trace that humans ever even existed.....except maybe deep....deep....in the sediment under the ocean you might find a few plastic bags with a fading logo (walmart).

So....don't worry about the planet. It will do just fine.
Yes! Finally a voice (and note it is feminine) of reason and clarity!

As to the nonsense ignoring reality about climate change, I'll pass, except to note this excellent summary of the situation by Brian Cox of the Guardian, trying to get past the silly argument that the vast majority of knowledgeable experts agree about what is going on, insofar as they are capable of understanding it:

"scientists could say with total confidence that climate science was uncontroversial and the current predictions for warming were the best advice available."

As to George Carlin, I've seen it several times. You've chosen to reinterpret it, but it's a wonderful clip.

As to hubris, the Democrats have nothing on it with Boehner, McConnell, Cruz, Ryan, the Supreme Court, and all the other bodies that want to roll back the 20th century and put short-term profits for the already wealthy ahead of the common weal.

You missed the biggest breakup of all, the breakup of the planet's climate, caused by an accumulation of exhalations from a society addicted to consumption, told they must continuously expand or bust, who decided the the air, water, and earth were either a cornucopia or a dump, depending on their needs.

The accumulation of heat-trapping greenhouse gases has reached a point where consequences are mounting. Earth is reacting to the most predatory species ever, gone mad with hubris and thinking its politics trump reality.

@blgreenie

"Determinations in cases of child abuse are made by professionals and agencies with expertise in doing so."

Uhm, no. Determinations as to whether a child has been abused or not is always made by a court, since child abuse is a crime. "Professionals and agencies" never make determinations as to guilt or innocence, unless they're judicial professionals or lay jury members.

@Andrew

You really ought to know better than to believer everything you read on the internet. An indictment is just one part of the story... and the prosecution's part at that. If everything a prosecutor alleges were true, then everyone ever charged with a crime would be guilty. There would never be any acquittals in our justice system. Let the system work and if he's found guilty then throw the book at him.

I assume you're talking about Boehner, McConnell, and the tea party's preference for limited government, along with their willingness to spend our capital endlessly preventing a moderate approach to health care for all, and make government of, by, and for the wealthy.  Why blame the victim?
Should the President have contradicted U.S. policy and advised the family to break the law?
thank you very much for your post.  This is something that has to be said.

You're not paying attention. Global warming is just getting started and it will be worse than all the rest.

People miss that there will be more crises worldwide as the energy in our system increases, with floods, droughts, wildfires, crop failures, loss of clean water, and so on.
The author writes that "the league has ordered an independent investigation."  Who is paying for the investigation?  The NFL?  Then it's not "independent."
I wonder if there is a connection between performance enhancing drugs and increased cases of violence.  There is a known correlation between steroids and rage.  Connect the dots!

I think AP should have "one hit his nuts" and see how he likes it.  I wouldn't whip a dog like that. Nothing on this planet justifies allowing that possibly steroid filled bully to be allowed the privilege of playing for the NFL. He isn't stupid, they are schooled on the morals clause up one side and down the other. Ignorance is no excuse of the law. As a school teacher I would be fired for doing that and so should he.
Here's to hoping he gets one in the privates like his kid did.

What utter nonsense.  Blame it on Obama.  That's the right-wing whine.  The US had the same policy to not negotiate with terrorists long before the President took office and will have it for a long time after he leaves.  Can you imagine how he would be excoriated by the right-wing if he negotiated for hostages? They whined about the prisoner swap for Bergdahl and called for an "investigation."  The only time I can recall Americans negotiating with terrorists was when Reagan cut a deal with the Iranian that were holding American hostages before the election in 1980 to insure that the hostages wouldn't be released until after the election, in effect getting in the way of the Carter Administrations efforts to have the hostages freed.  Ronnie worried that a release of the hostages before the election might lead to a Carter victory in the election.  Reagan also subsequently negotiated with Iranian terrorists, illegally selling eight shipments of arms to Iran for cash and the hope that hostages would be released.  The first two shipments went through Israel.  Although it didn't free too many hostages, it did give the Reagan administration money to send arms to the Contras in Nicaragua, who probably also qualified as terrorists by most definitions.  Congress had passed the Boland Amendment, which expressly prohibited sending arms to the Contras.  And they say that Obama thinks he's a king.
The only problem with your argument is that Obama is not and never has been and doesn't even want to be a liberal.  That much is obvious.
Karl Rove could not have spun it better himself.

This is the ultimate end-result of Obama's "foreign policy."  Yes, it feels good to hear all the speeches.  It satisfies the liberal ego to feel nuanced and sophisticated and intellectual and "better than those conservatives who only see black and white."  But, sadly, in the end, it's a fools paradise.  When your enemies use raw power, intimidation, and killing to achieve their ends, and the "good side" only uses speeches, diplomacy, and soft power, it's clear who will win in the long-run.

EEE, I'll give you the benefit of the doubt that you have not seen the pictures of this 4 year old child's injuries.  But if you have and have also read his statements that he did indeed inflict those injuries on a 4 year old then you might want to brush up on your definition of sensationalism.
correction @Chris, make that "has dog killers, wife killers/suicides"...and hope no one crosses that final line.
You are letting 10-12 guys to ruin everything. Remember, there are alot of players and a lot of them are great people.

The NFL has dog beaters, wife beaters, and now child beaters.

They just lost me as a fan.

Of course, if we would heed the warnings of those knowledgeable about climate, these leaders might actually do something about the sixth extinction.  But I doubt they have the will, and you seem to be focusing on other things entirely.

To those wondering about the indictment, I would just try and watch Keith Olbermann's show from today.  He had all the information and texts that Peterson sent to the mother.  It's probably on ESPN's website.

Assuming that the Islamic State would have taken only $5 million each for the releases of James Foley and Steven Sotloff (France recently paid $40 million for four of its citizens held hostage by an Al Qaeda affiliated group), how many other human beings would the Islamic State have killed with that $10 million? I tend to think it would have been more than two.

Clearly, the families of James Foley and Steven Sotloff are devastated by their deaths and angry about the fact that the U.S. policy doesn't allow for pay-offs or trades of convicted felons for American hostages. However, the European policy of paying off the terrorists likely results in a far larger number of human deaths than the American and UK policy.
nice to see the MN vikings choose football and the face of their franchise over child abuse. pathetic!!! what's next, they pimp kids during half-time to make more money???

Nice fellow. Fathers children with multiple women, doesn't commit to the women, physically abuses the kids. Is he better at running away from commitment and responsibility or from linebackers and safeties? I'd say he's pretty good at both.

Let's face it.  No negotiation has been our policy for a very long time.  I feel greatly for the Foley family.  What they have had to go through is horrible.  I hope the can recover to some degree and enjoy the positive moments from Jame's life.  However, we cannot negotiate with these parasites.  If we do, it will get worse.  Every American and western citizen has to know their life is at risk in that part of the world and they have to take responsibilities for themselves at this time.  Hopefully we can eradicate this plague on the world.

The Wilf family (owners of the Vikings) was sued and lost a civil judgement for $84.5 million dollars for defrauding their business partner.  They are morally ethically challenged.  Hardly a surprise they would bring Peterson back.  They are an embarrassment to the State of Minnesota.
If all governments refused to pay ransoms and refused to allow ransoms to be paid privately, would terrorists continue to kidnap for ransom?

This four-year-old is not "Daddy Peterson['s]" first juvenile beating victim.

He's done this before, and he'll do it again.
Sadly, corporal punishment is legal in schools in many states.  Yes, children can be legally beaten in schools! And we wonder why so many parents use physical punishment?
Journalists and war correspondents?
